intro: Stellarioides canaliculata, commonly known as the narrowleaf starwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, wetlands, and along streambanks. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators. Stellarioides canaliculata is generally a short-lived perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
